chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury
Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Onterio Martez Girley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 10-01-2025. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to count 1 but concurrent to revocation sentence in case #11CF2754

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Onterio Martez Girley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Onterio Martez Girley in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Onterio Martez Girley.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading and entered temporary pleas of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 but CONCURRENT to revocation sentence in case #11CF2754. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Count 1 but CONCURRENT to revocation sentence in case #11CF2754. 

Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.  Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 10-01-2025.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Onterio Martez Girley not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Onterio Martez Girley.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for jury trial.  Defendant intends to proceed with plea/sentencing, however, Attorney Hall is in trial in another court.  Court set matter for plea/sentencing in Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Onterio Martez Girley not in court, in custody.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for final pretrial.  Defense counsel is in trial on another matter.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. 
Expires: 11-08-2022
Received and Filed:  State's Notice of Motion to Adjourn.

Attorney Jade K Hall in court, defendant Onterio Martez Girley not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 8-30-2022 and all responses to be filed by 9-27-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jade K Hall in court, defendant Onterio Martez Girley not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense requests a scheduling conference.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Onterio Martez Girley in court with Attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Onterio Martez Girley in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Wieting. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Jade Hall

Defendant Onterio Martez Girley not in court, defendant in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Onterio Martez Girley in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Onterio Martez Girley in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Onterio Martez Girley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
